required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Label, Healthy Volunteers, ADME Study With Single Oral Administration of [14C] AZD5069
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label Study to Characterise the Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism and Excretion Following a Single Oral Dose of [14C]AZD5069 in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase I, open label, healthy volunteers, ADME study with single oral administration of [14C] AZD5069.

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of AZD5069 in human subjects by measuring the amount of [14C] radioactivity in plasma and whole blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: From pre-dose until 168 hours post last dose
primary_outcome.description: To investigate the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of AZD5069 in human subjects by measuring the amount of [14C] radioactivity in plasma and whole blood and the resulting area under the concentration-time curve from zero extrapolated to infinity (AUC), to the last measurable concentration (AUC(0 t)).

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of AZD5069 in human subjects by measuring Plasma [14C] AZD5069:AZD5069 (cold) ratios for concentrations and selected pharmacokinetic parameters (AUCs and Cmax).
primary_outcome.time_frame: From pre-dose until 168hours post last dose

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate the excretion of AZD5069 in human subjects by measuring the amount and percentage of radioactive dose recovered in urine, faeces, and renal clearance.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From pre-dose until 168hours post last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: To investigate the safety and tolerability of AZD5069 given orally
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening visit, Day 12, up to follow up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments will include adverse events, vital signs, electrocardiogram, haematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis and physical examination. Absolute values and change in baseline for any of these parameters will be reported.

intervention.description: Single 120 mg oral dose administered on Day 1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a body mass index (BMI) of ≥18 and ≤30 kg/m2 and weight of ≥50 kg and ≤100 kg.
- Regular daily bowel movements (ie, production of at least 1 stool per day).
- Non-smoker or ex-smoker who has not used tobacco or nicotine products for ≥6 months prior to Visit 1
- Healthy Male volunteers aged 50 and over
Exclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers who have been exposed to radiation levels above background (eg, through X-ray examination) of >5 mSv in the last year, >10 mSv in the last 5 years, or a cumulative total of >1 mSv per year of life
- Participation in any prior radiolabelled study within last 5 years
- History of alcohol abuse or excessive intake of alcohol as judged by the investigator.

overall_official.affiliation: Quintiles Drug Research Unit at Guy's Hospital
